title: Formula for Value of an Annuity
text: For a principal, P, invested at the end of a compounding period, with an interest rate, $$r$$, which is compounded $$n$$ times in a year, the new balance A, after $$t$$ years, is $$A_t=\frac{P \left({\left(1+\frac{r}{n}\right)}^{nt}-1\right)}{\frac{r}{n}}$$.
